text: What's the logical value of "string" in Python?
I erroneously wrote this code in Python:

code:
name = input("what is your name?")
if name == "Kamran" or "Samaneh":
    print("That is a nice name")
else:
    print("You have a boring name ;)")

text: It always prints out "That is a nice name" even when the input is neither "Kamran" nor "Samaneh".
Am I correct in saying that it considers "Samaneh" as a true?
By the way, I already noticed my mistake.
